tldr: The `surf` crate is no longer maintained, as indicated by the developer. Its last release dates back to 2021—over three years ago—making it outdated. It relies on the deprecated `async-std` runtime and an obsolete version of `rustls` for TLS support, both of which introduce risks related to security, performance, and compatibility with modern Rust tooling. Use of this crate is discouraged in favor of actively maintained alternatives.
doest_this_affect_me: You are affected if you are using this package.
how_to_fix: Remove any GTK3 package from your application. Please take a look at reqwest or ureq instead.
vulnerable_to: Use of Unmaintained Third Party Components
